title: How to Make a Signal Flare

steps.title: Mix together the potassium nitrate and the aluminum powder.
steps.content: Mix together the potassium nitrate and the aluminum powder. Other metals will work, such as copper powder, zinc powder, potassium permanganate makes a purple flame. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Cook the mixture on low heat for awhile and take it off and let it cool in a bucket or something.
steps.content: Cook the mixture on low heat for awhile and take it off and let it cool in a bucket or something.

steps.title: Add the bonding agent to the mixture and wait for awhile.
steps.content: Add the bonding agent to the mixture and wait for awhile.

steps.title: Add the mixture while it's about half done drying, put it into your cylinder tube.
steps.content: Add the mixture while it's about half done drying, put it into your cylinder tube. Also put in a few matches while it dries.

steps.title: Light it up.
steps.content: Light it up. Put it on the ground and have some fun. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Mix 1/2 cup powdered sugar and 3/4 cup potassium nitrate in a shake-able container or jar.
steps.content: Mix 1/2 cup powdered sugar and 3/4 cup potassium nitrate in a shake-able container or jar. Shake and turn the container to allow the material to be thoroughly mixed. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Light a propane camp stove in a safe, outdoor location.
steps.content: Light a propane camp stove in a safe, outdoor location. Crank the flame down to a low level. Most propane stoves will produce a 1/4-inch high flame at this level.

steps.title: Place the flare mixture in a heavy skillet and heat it slowly.
steps.content: Place the flare mixture in a heavy skillet and heat it slowly. Stir the mixture constantly. As the flare gum heats it will take on the consistency of melted plastic or chewed gum. Once the material gets to a consistency that allows it to be rolled over in the skillet, it is done. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the skillet from the heat and allow the mixture to cool for 30 minutes.
steps.content: Remove the skillet from the heat and allow the mixture to cool for 30 minutes.

steps.title: Shape the cooled flare material into a long, rectangular bar.
steps.content: Shape the cooled flare material into a long, rectangular bar. Insert three matches -- wood-end first -- into one end of the flare. Push them in until the base of the match head is touching the material.

steps.title: Wrap the flare in tissue paper and provide a 2-inch long paper end.
steps.content: Wrap the flare in tissue paper and provide a 2-inch long paper end. Twist the end of the paper and put the flare in a self-seal plastic bag.
